description:
Change I8f6a857b88659ee30b4aa1a25ac52d7e01156a68 added typed consoles, and updated drivers to use them. However, when it touched the VMware driver, it modified get_vnc_console in VMwareVMOps, but not in VMwareVCVMOps, which is the one which is actually used.

Incidentally, VMwareVMOps has now been removed, so this type of confusion should not happen again.
title: VMware driver doesn't return typed console

comments.content:
Change I8f6a857b88659ee30b4aa1a25ac52d7e01156a68 added typed consoles, and updated drivers to use them. However, when it touched the VMware driver, it modified get_vnc_console in VMwareVMOps, but not in VMwareVCVMOps, which is the one which is actually used.

Incidentally, VMwareVMOps has now been removed, so this type of confusion should not happen again.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mbooth-9

commit c4d0e55098952ad3180f74357a9256da43bf7d15
Author: Matthew Booth <email address hidden>
Date:   Wed Sep 3 10:21:51 2014 +0100

    VMware: Fix return type of get_vnc_console()
    
    Change I8f6a857b88659ee30b4aa1a25ac52d7e01156a68 changed the return type of
    get_vnc_console(), but didn't update it in VMwareVCVMOps.
    
    Closes-Bug: #1364849
    Change-Id: I25edf0a19fa79439ed375ad128d0050718d04cb3
